histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.External.Modeset.AttemptSucceeded
histogram.summary: Modeset attempt result of an external display. Every time an external display is connected/disconnected, or when the display mode of the external screen is changed by the user, Chrome attempts to modeset the display. This metric tracks the result of those attempts. Resolution and RefreshRate metrics will be recorded for each attempt.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.External.Modeset.FinalStatus
histogram.summary: Modeset attempt result of an internal display. This is recorded after Chrome attempted all the available modes and finally modeset the display. All the previously attempted modes and refreshes, including the successful one will be recorded.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.External.Modeset.RefreshRate
histogram.summary: Refresh rate of the mode for the display we're about to modeset. This is recorded every time an external display is connected/disconnected, or when the display mode of the external screen is about to change.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.External.Modeset.Resolution
histogram.summary: DisplayResolution of the mode for the external display we're about to modeset. 0 means the display was powered off. This is recorded every time an external display is connected/disconnected, or when the display mode of the external screen is about to change.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Internal.Modeset.AttemptSucceeded
histogram.summary: Modeset attempt result of an internal display. Chrome might try additional modes after a failed attempt. Every time an external display is connected/disconnected, or when the display mode of the external screen is changed by the user, Chrome attempts to modeset the display. This metric tracks the result of those attempts. Resolution and RefreshRate metrics will be recorded for each attempt.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Internal.Modeset.FinalStatus
histogram.summary: Modeset attempt result of an internal display. This is recorded after Chrome attempted all the available modes and finally modeset the display. All the previously attempted modes and refreshes, including the successful one will be recorded.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Internal.Modeset.RefreshRate
histogram.summary: Refresh rate of the mode for the display we're about to modeset. This is recorded every time the internal display is powered on/off, or when an external monitor is plugged in.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Internal.Modeset.Resolution
histogram.summary: DisplayResolution of the mode for the internal display we're about to modeset. 0 means the display was powered off. This is recorded every time the internal display is powered on/off, or when an external monitor is plugged in.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Modeset.MstExternalDisplaysCount
histogram.summary: Total number of external displays connected via MST and being configured. This is recorded every time an external display is connected/disconnected, or when the display mode of a screen is about to change.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Modeset.MstExternalDisplaysPercentage
histogram.summary: Percentage of external displays connected via MST and being configured. This is recorded every time an external display is connected/disconnected, or when the display mode of a screen is about to change.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.Modeset.TotalExternalDisplaysCount
histogram.summary: Total number of external displays being configured. This is recorded every time an external display is connected/disconnected, or when the display mode of a screen is about to change.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.{Connection}.Modeset.Success.RefreshRate
histogram.summary: Tracks an {Connection} display's resulting refresh rate after a successful display configuration.

histogram.name: ConfigureDisplays.{Connection}.Modeset.{Report}.Resolution
histogram.summary: {Connection} {Report}

variant.name: OriginalRequest
variant.summary: original resolution request during display configuration.

variant.name: Success
variant.summary: resulting resolution after a successful display configuration.

histogram.name: Display.External.BlockZeroSerialNumberType
histogram.summary: The type of serial number retrieved from block zero of a display's EDID during EDID parsing.

histogram.name: Display.External.NumOfSerialNumbersProvided
histogram.summary: The number of serial numbers provided in an EDID (i.e. via block zero and/or the serial number descriptor block). Values should be in the range of 0-2.

histogram.name: Display.External.ParseEdidOptionals
histogram.summary: The availability (or lack thereof) of tracked optional fields during EDID parsing of external.

histogram.name: Display.MultipleDisplays.GenerateId.CollisionDetection
histogram.summary: Whether or not multiple connected displays produced identical display IDs due to incomplete EDIDs. This may occur when identical displays (same make and model) lack serial numbers in both the EDID's block zero or S/N descriptor block. Recorded every time Chrome OS detects a change in display configuration and attempts to get an updated list of available displays.

histogram.name: Display.ParseEdidFailure
histogram.summary: Type of failure that occurs during EDID parsing. Typically the failure is caused by a mismatch between the EDID size and the expected offset of the data component.

histogram.name: GPU.AcceleratedSurfaceRefreshRate
histogram.summary: Refresh rate of the display in Hz. This is recorded every time we present a frame.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.Buffer11CPUMemoryMB
histogram.summary: The sum of the size of the CPU-side memory allocations of Buffer11's copies (vs. GPU memory allocations). These allocations are used when modifying the buffer data on the CPU or when transfering to GPU memory via DMA.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.D3D11CreateDeviceError
histogram.summary: An extended Windows error code returned from D3D11CreateDevice on error when ANGLE's D3D backend is in use. Can be almost any valid HRESULT or DXGI error code, which are listed at https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/bb509553.aspx.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.D3D11FeatureLevel
histogram.summary: The maxmium supported (or currently requested) Direct3D feature level in D3D11 ANGLE. We support as low as 9.3, and as high as 11.1, though Chrome should only use 10.0+ for D3D11. Gives an indication of how new a user's video card is, what features it supports, and it's general speed tier. Recorded on D3D device initialization, loss, or reset when ANGLE's D3D backend is in use.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.D3D11InitializeResult
histogram.summary: The result from initializing a D3D11 device in ANGLE. Can be success, or one of several error codes which indicate different reasons for failing. Recorded on D3D11 device initialization when ANGLE's D3D backend is in use.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.D3D9InitializeResult
histogram.summary: The result from initializing a D3D9 device in ANGLE. Can be success, or one of several error codes which indicate different reasons for failing. Recorded on D3D9 device initialization when ANGLE's D3D backend is in use.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.SupportsDXGI1_2
histogram.summary: Windows computers running Windows 8+, or running Windows 7 with a platform update, support the newer version of DXGI. This update also indicates the computer is capable of running Direct3D 11.1 if the hardware supports it. Recorded on D3D11 device initialization when ANGLE's D3D backend is in use.

histogram.name: GPU.AppContainer.EnableState
histogram.summary: On Windows 10 version RS1 and above the GPU can be sandboxed using an AppContainer. This is recorded every time the GPU sandbox is initialized and enabling the AppContainer is requested, such as through a command line option. The recorded value can indicate that the AppContainer was disabled due to an incompatible configuration or the GPU process had previously crashed resulting in the AppContainer being forcefully disabled.

histogram.name: GPU.AppContainer.Status
histogram.summary: On Windows 10 version RS1 and above the GPU can be sandboxed using an AppContainer. This indicates the status when initializing the sandbox profile during process creation.

histogram.name: GPU.AppHelpIsLoaded
histogram.summary:
Records whether AppHelp.dll is loaded at GPU initialization. Only recorded on Windows platform at GPU process launch time.
It is not yet known what exactly is triggering the load of AppHelp.dll, and so we can't be sure that AppHelp.dll won't be loaded after this is collected, even if this metric is false.
A bug tracking metric collection related to the application compatibility layer can be found at crbug.com/1357617.
Part of a performance investigation that Catan is doing into GPU startup time.

histogram.name: GPU.BlocklistFeatureTestResults
histogram.summary: Counts number of browser invocations for which a GPU feature is allowed/blocklisted/disabled.

histogram.name: GPU.BlocklistTestResultsPerEntry
histogram.summary: Counts number of browser invocations for which the GPU process is blocked due to a blocklist entry match.

histogram.name: GPU.CanvasOopRaster.OopRasterAndGpuAcceleration
histogram.summary: Records, during GPU process initialization, the combination of the following two features being enabled/disabled: 1) Accelerated 2D Canvas 2) OOP Rasterization of Canvas.

histogram.name: GPU.CompositingMode
histogram.summary: Records what compositing mode (software, GL, etc.) Chrome is using every five minutes. This is the default compositing mode that most windows will use. There are some window types (eg. menus on some platforms) that always use software compositing and ignore the default.

histogram.name: GPU.ContextLost
histogram.summary: The reason a GPU command buffer context of a given type was lost.

histogram.name: GPU.D3D11_B8G8R8A8_RenderTargetSupport
histogram.summary: Whether D3D11 supports B8G8R8A8 format for render targets.

histogram.name: GPU.D3D11_B8G8R8A8_Texture2DSupport
histogram.summary: Whether D3D11 supports B8G8R8A8 format for 2D textures.

histogram.name: GPU.D3D11FeatureLevel
histogram.summary: Records the highest D3D_FEATURE_LEVEL available, collected in the info collection GPU process, once per UMA ping. This is Windows platform only.

histogram.name: GPU.D3D12FeatureLevel
histogram.summary: The maximum D3D12 feature level supported in the gpu drivers. It is recorded in the browser process 120 seconds after the browser launch.

histogram.name: GPU.D3D12HighestShaderModel2
histogram.summary: The maximum supported D3D shader model version on a D3D12 device. It is recorded in the browser process 120 seconds after the browser launch. Note that the "2" suffix was added when a fix was made in how this stat is collected: the previous unsuffixed version would store "unknown/unsupported" on systems that supported shader model 5.1 to 6.5, but were unaware of 6.6. The suffixed version correctly stores the highest supported shader model.

histogram.name: GPU.D3DShaderModel
histogram.summary: ANGLE's currently active D3D shader model version. Logged once every startup of the GPU process, on Windows only. Note that Shader Models 2 and 3 map to D3D9 with ANGLE, and 4+ map to D3D11 ANGLE.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.ApprovedPresentDuration
histogram.summary: If the system approves a swap chain's custom present duration request, this is the approved custom present duration. If the swap chain's custom present duration request is not approved, this is zero.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.CompositionMode2.VideoOrCanvas
histogram.summary: How the Desktop Window Manager presented Chrome's DirectComposition layers of video or canvas elements to the screen. Only recorded on Windows.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.CreateSwapChainForComposition
histogram.summary: HRESULT return value of IDXGIFactory2::CreateSwapChainForComposition.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.DCLayer.YUVOverlayCount
histogram.summary: The number of YUV overlays we are going to present in each frame if the number is not 0. Recorded when the overlay processor is called for drawing a frame.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.DCLayerResult.StreamVideo
histogram.summary: Recorded for each stream video quad (on overlay processing) the reason it was or wasn't put in an overlay.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.DCLayerResult.Texture
histogram.summary: Recorded for each texture quad (on overlay processing) the reason it was or wasn't put in an overlay. (This metric might be lack of coverage between 2022-05-01 and 2022-06-24 due to metric expiration.)

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.DCLayerResult.Video
histogram.summary: Recorded for each quad (on overlay processing) with protected video type the reason it was or wasn't put in an overlay.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.DcompDeviceCreateSurface
histogram.summary: HRESULT return value of IDCompositionDevice2::CreateSurface.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.DecodeSwapChainCreationResult
histogram.summary: Result of calling CreateDecodeSwapChainForCompositionSurfaceHandle. Recorded when decode swap chain is created.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.DecodeSwapChainNotUsedReason
histogram.summary: The reason decode swap chain wasn't used to present a video frame. Recorded on each present. See also GPU.DirectComposition.VideoPresentationMode.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.HardwareOverlaysSupported
histogram.summary: True if the GPU driver supports hardware overlays. Recorded during Chrome GPU initialization and each time the overlay caps change.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.IsUnderlay
histogram.summary: Recorded for each video quad during the video playback whether it is an underlay or an overlay.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.NumPendingFrames
histogram.summary: Number of presented frames for which presentation queries haven't completed. Recorded on each vblank.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.OverlayFormatUsed3
histogram.summary: Which overlay format was chosen for YUV overlays. Recorded once per GPU process launch only if hardware overlays are supported. (Might be lack of metrics coverage between 2022-05-01 and 2022-06-24 due to metric expiration.)

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.OverlaysSupported
histogram.summary: True if Chrome will try to use DirectComposition overlays. (Might be lack of metrics coverage between 2021-10-04 and 2022-06-24 due to metric expiration.)

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.SwapChainCreationResult2
histogram.summary: Whether creating swap chain for overlay format succeeded. Recorded once per swap chain creation.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.SwapChainCreationResult3
histogram.summary: Whether creating swap chain for protected video succeeded. Recorded once per swap chain creation.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.SwapChainFormat3
histogram.summary: What format was used for each overlay swap chain on each swap buffers. (Might be lack of metrics coverage between 2020-12-31 and 2022-06-24 due to metric expiration.)

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.VideoPresentationMode
histogram.summary: What code path was used to present a video frame. Recorded on each present. (Might be lack of metrics coverage between 2022-03-06 and 2022-06-24 due to metric expiration.)

histogram.name: GPU.DriverBugTestResultsPerEntry
histogram.summary: For every entry in the gpu driver bug list that is hit on a machine, this records the id. Entry 0 is the total number of times that data is recorded. It should be recorded whenever new GPU information is received: on startup, whenever a GPU process launches, and whenever the active GPU changes.

histogram.name: GPU.EGLDisplayType
histogram.summary: The display type used to ask for an EGLDisplay.

histogram.name: GPU.EnsureWorkVisibleDuration
histogram.summary:
Records the duration of EnsureWorkVisible GPU call. Since it's blocking UI thread we want to measure it, and this histogram must be active as long as this call is still blocking.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution.

histogram.name: GPU.EnsureWorkVisibleDurationLowRes
histogram.summary:
Records the duration of EnsureWorkVisible GPU call. Since it's blocking UI thread we want to measure it, and this histogram must be active as long as this call is still blocking.
This is a sister histogram to GPU.EnsureWorkVisibleDuration. The former is our target goal. However it's custom buckets do not have enough granularity to measure improvement steps. This metric will instead cap at 5s, and allow the buckets to give us better visibility into the 15ms-250ms interval ranges. We will use this one until we improve the blocking call.

histogram.name: GPU.Error
histogram.summary: The error states generated by OpenGL calls.

histogram.name: GPU.EstablishGpuChannelSyncTime
histogram.summary: Measures the time it takes to synchronously establish the GPU channel. Logged every time a sync call to EstableGpuChannelSync is made and a channel is not already available.

histogram.name: GPU.FenceSupport
histogram.summary: Whether GLFence support is available. Recorded each time a new context group is initialized and extensions are detected.

histogram.name: Gpu.GL.GetErrorDuration.GLImageEGL.BindTexImage
histogram.summary: The time that elapsed for a call to glGetError to complete while trying to bind a GLImageEGL to a texture. The goal is to measure the impact of the potential sync barrier that glGetError represents. Only reported for platforms supporting high resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Gpu.GL.GetErrorResult.GLImageEGL.BindTexImage
histogram.summary: Whether glGetError actually returned an error while trying to bind a GLImageEGL to a texture. The goal is to evaluate how often the call to glGetError might actually serve its purpose.

histogram.name: Gpu.GL.ProgramBuildTime
histogram.summary: The time that elapsed between a call to glCreateProgram and the call to query GL_LINK_STATUS via glGetProgramiv in Skia's GrGLInterface. This encompasses the creation of the vertex, fragment, and geometry shaders, their compilation, and their linking. This is called for every program created by Skia via the GrGLInterface.

histogram.name: GPU.GLES2DecoderImplLazyBindingCheck.WasBindNecessary
histogram.summary: For each lazy binding check of GLImage performed by GLES2DecoderImpl, records whether binding was actually necessary or not. Used in the effort to eliminate these lazy binding checks (crbug.com/1323341).

histogram.name: GPU.GLES2DecoderPassthroughImplLazyBindingCheck.WasBindNecessary
histogram.summary: For each lazy binding check of GLImage performed by GLES2DecoderPassthroughImpl, records whether binding was actually necessary or not. Used in the effort to eliminate these lazy binding checks (crbug.com/1323341).

histogram.name: GPU.GLImplementation
histogram.summary: Records the OpenGL implementation mode. Recorded during GPU process initilization.

histogram.name: GPU.GpuCount
histogram.summary: The number of GPUs a device has, excluding software renderers. Recorded when GPU process launches and sends GPUInfo to browser process.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUInitializationTime.V3
histogram.summary: The time between the GPU process starts and the GPU Info is collected at GPU process startup and recorded in browser process when this piece info is sent back to browser process. The range is between 5ms and 5s.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUInitializationTime.V4
histogram.summary:
The time between the GPU process start and the collection of GPU info during the process's startup phase. The time range is between 5ms and 90s. Emitted after the collection of GPU info. Reported for all clients.
This metric is similar to GPU.GPUInitializationTime.V3, but there are two main differences. First, the range for GPU.GPUInitializationTime.V4 is capped at 90s while the range of the other metric is capped at 5s. Second, this metric is emitted earlier in the execution because this metric is recorded at the same time as trace events which require the timestamp marking the start and end of the GPU initialization to be in scope, whereas V3 only requires the time spent.
The purpose of this metric is to investigate the long tail of GPU startup time. See crbug/1350257.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUProcessExitCode
histogram.summary: Counts for the exit codes returned by the GPU process when it terminated.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUProcessInitialized
histogram.summary: Whether the GPU process successfully initialized or failed and then exitted normally.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUProcessLaunchTime
histogram.summary: Startup time of the GPU process as measured by the GPU process host.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUProcessTerminationOrigin
histogram.summary: The reason a GPU process is terminated. It works only when TERMINATION_STATUS_PROCESS_WAS_KILLED TerminationStatus is set. The goal of this histogram is to get spikes of the above mentioned case when Ozone/Wayland terminates the GPU process due to invalid data it received if any.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUProcessTerminationStatus2
histogram.summary: Counts for each time the GPU Process Host detects the process dies.

histogram.name: GPU.HardwareAccelerationModeEnabled
histogram.summary:
Records if GPU hardware acceleration is explicitly disabled by the user. Recorded when the browser process launches.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-01-30 to 2022-04-29; data may be missing.

histogram.name: GPU.HasDiscreteGpu
histogram.summary:
Records whether the system has a discrete GPU, collected in the info collection GPU process, once per UMA ping. This is Windows platform only.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2020-04-24 to 2022-04-29; data may be missing.

histogram.name: GPU.InitializeOneOffMediumTime
histogram.summary: The time that the GPU process spends in initializing the GL surface, and collecting graphics information. Records times up to three minutes.

histogram.name: GPU.IntelGpuGeneration
histogram.summary: Records the highest Intel GPU generation of the system using the GPU info collected at GPU process startup time, once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: GPU.IntelGpuSeriesType
histogram.summary: Records user device's GPU series type. Only recorded on Windows platform at GPU process launch time. Only meaningful with Intel GPUs.

histogram.name: GPU.IOSurface.CATransactionTimeUs
histogram.summary: The time that it took to update the CALayer tree and commit the transaction. This is often affected by IOSurface paging. This metric is only collected on Mac, which only has high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.IOSurface.CreateTime
histogram.summary: The time that it took for a call to IOSurfaceCreate to complete.

histogram.name: GPU.IOSurface.GLFlushTime
histogram.summary: The time that it took for a call to glFlush to complete. This is often affected by IOSurface paging.

histogram.name: GPU.IOSurface.TexImageTime
histogram.summary: The time that it took for a call to CGLTexImageIOSurface2D to complete.

histogram.name: Gpu.Mac.BackpressureUs
histogram.summary: The time that the GPU's main CPU thread spends waiting for previous frames' GPU work to complete. Recorded at every frame. This metric is only collected on Mac, which only has high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.MaxMSAASampleCount
histogram.summary: The maximum number of multisampled anti-aliasing (MSAA) samples per pixel that the user's GPU can render.

histogram.name: Gpu.Metal.ReadWriteTextureSupport
histogram.summary: Read-write textures are not always supported on Metal. This histograms is meant to gather information so that the WebGPU W3C group can decide whether to require support for this feature. The reported tier is the best tier that was found on the system. Meaning that if only one of the GPUs support read-write textures, a non-zero tier will be reported. The histogram is recorded at GPU process startup time.

histogram.name: Gpu.Metal.TestShaderCompileTime
histogram.summary: Compiling a MTLLibrary will sometimes hang forever. When initializing the gpu process, a test shader is compiled to see if the MTLCompilerService is responding or not. This records the time that it took for the compile to succeeded, up to 1 minute. After 1 minute, a timeout sentinel value of 3 minutes is reported.

histogram.name: Gpu.Metal.TestShaderLinkTime
histogram.summary: Linking a MTLRenderPipelineState will sometimes hang forever. When initializing the GPU process, a test shader is compiled to see if the MTLCompilerService is responding or not. This records the time that it took for the compile to succeeded, up to 1 minute. After 1 minute, a timeout sentinel value of 3 minutes is reported.

histogram.name: Gpu.MetalProxy.NewLibraryTime
histogram.summary: The time that it takes to create a new MTLLibrary, including all retries. Recorded after every call to -[MTLDeviceProxy newLibraryWithSource:] completes.

histogram.name: Gpu.MetalProxy.NewRenderPipelineStateTime
histogram.summary: The time that it takes to create a new MTLRenderPipelineState, including all retries. Recorded after every call to -[MTLDeviceProxy newRenderPipelineStateWithDescriptor:] completes.

histogram.name: GPU.MultiGpu.AMD
histogram.summary: AMD device IDs from multi-gpu devices. Recorded when GPU process launches and sends GPUInfo to browser process.

histogram.name: GPU.MultiGpu.Nvidia
histogram.summary: Nvidia device IDs from multi-gpu devices. Recorded when GPU process launches and sends GPUInfo to browser process.

histogram.name: GPU.MultipleSwapsDelta
histogram.summary: Time delta between swaps, when there are multiple successful swaps in the same vsync. The delta is reported as a percentage of vsync interval. This can be recorded every time we present a frame.

histogram.name: GPU.OopRaster.GlyphCacheMiss
histogram.summary: During OutOfProcess(Oop) raster, the renderer generates and sends the requisite glyph data for rasterizing a tile with the serialized paint commands. If the data for any glyph is missing, the GPU process attempts to use a fallback glyph from the cache. This records each time we encounter a cache miss on the GPU and whether we could use a fallback.

histogram.name: GPU.Output.HDR
histogram.summary: Records if any connected monitor is HDR capable. Recorded when the gpu process starts. Only recorded on Windows as of M-61. If monitor enumeration fails, this metric will not be provided.

histogram.name: Gpu.OutputSurface.ScheduleOverlaysUs
histogram.summary: The time that the GPU's main CPU thread spends producing pending CALayer tree on Mac. Recorded when Skia output surface schedules overlays at every frame. This metric is only collected on Mac, which only has high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.PaintOpReader.DeserializationError
histogram.summary: Records the reason why the deserialization of a PaintOp failed. Recorded in PaintOpReader::Read* methods when the decoding a paint op fails. These failures are typically caused by an invalid or unexpected state or invalid serialized data.

histogram.name: GPU.PassthroughDoLinkProgramTime
histogram.summary: The time we spend in GLES2DecoderPassthroughImpl::DoLinkProgram. Related to how much time we spend compiling shaders during startup. Expired in June 2022, and revived in M106. Data may be incomplete for the period during which the histogram was expired.

histogram.name: GPU.ProcessIntegrityResult
histogram.summary: Summarize the configurations for the integrity level of GPU process, logged by the Browser process before launching GPU process, used for configuring the GPU sandbox.

histogram.name: GPU.ProcessLifetimeEvents.DisplayCompositor
histogram.summary: Recorded once for every GPU process launch and crash when GPU process is started for the display compositor with software compositing. Crash buckets are based on crash count for disabling features. No hardware acceleration and no SwiftShader WebGL will be run.

histogram.name: GPU.ProcessLifetimeEvents.HardwareAccelerated
histogram.summary: Recorded once for every GPU process launch and crash when GPU process is started for hardware accelerated GPU compositing and/or WebGL. Crash buckets are based on crash count for disabling features. With OOP-D enabled the display compositor also runs in the GPU process.

histogram.name: GPU.ProcessLifetimeEvents.SwiftShader
histogram.summary: Recorded once for every GPU process launch and crash when GPU process is started for SwiftShader WebGL. Crash buckets are based on crash count for disabling features. With OOP-D enabled the display compositor with software compositing will also run as part of the GPU process.

histogram.name: GPU.ProgramCache.CacheHit
histogram.summary: If a successfully linked program was found in the GPU program cache during a program link call. Expired in June 2022, and revived in M106. Data may be incomplete for the period during which the histogram was expired.

histogram.name: GPU.ProgramCache.CompilationCacheHitTime
histogram.summary:
The time to check the program cache that we've already compiled the shader.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: GPU.ProgramCache.CompilationCacheMissTime
histogram.summary:
The time to compile a shader.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Gpu.Rasterization.Raster.MSAASampleCountLog2
histogram.summary: log2() of MSAA sample count of a raster task. Value is in [log2(1),log2(64)] or [0,6] range. If log2() of the MSAA sample count is 0 (MSAA sample count is 1), it means MSAA is disabled.

histogram.name: Gpu.Rasterization.Raster.NumPaintOps
histogram.summary: Number of paint ops in a raster task.

histogram.name: Gpu.Rasterization.Raster.NumSlowPathsUpToMinForMSAA
histogram.summary: Number of slow paths in a raster task. (Only counts up to the minimum required for MSAA)

histogram.name: GPU.RenderableFormat.{FORMAT_TYPE}
histogram.summary: Whether or not a {FORMAT_TYPE} fbo is complete and renderable.

histogram.name: GPU.ReportOnlyModeStatusAtHang
histogram.summary:
Records whether report only mode is enabled at GPU process watchdog hang time. Currently, we are not seeing any of the hangs/crashes reported by report-only mode, despite the experiment rolling out.
General Catan investigation: https://crbug.com/1350257
Report only feature: https://crbug.com/1356196
Part of a performance investigation that Catan is doing into GPU startup time.

histogram.name: GPU.Sandbox.InitializedSuccessfully
histogram.summary: Whether or not the GPU sandbox properly initialized. Failures are typically platform- and driver-specific (e.g. driver creating threads on Linux).

histogram.name: GPU.Scheduler.TaskDependencyTime
histogram.summary: Records the wall time taken spent by each GPU scheduler task waiting on it's dependencies to resolve. The time delta starts when the waiting fence is added and finishes when the last fence is removed. Only recorded for clients with high resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.Scheduler.TaskSchedulingDelayTime
histogram.summary: Records the wall time taken spent by each GPU scheduler task waiting on to be scheduled once all its dependencies have been resolved. The time delta starts when the last waiting fence is passed and stops when the tasks starts running. If the schedulers is working properly, for a high priority task, this metric should be minimal. Only recorded for clients with high resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.Scheduler.ThreadSuspendedTime
histogram.summary: Records the wall time taken between calls to schedule the task run and the actual run of the task. Ideally this should always be as close to 0 as possible. Only recorded for clients with high resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.setIsAcceleratedCompositingActive
histogram.summary: Counts activation and deactivation of accelerated compositing.

histogram.name: GPU.SharedImage.ContentConsumed
histogram.summary: Whether or not the content of a SharedImage is consumed. False indicates the content of a SharedImage is never used due to destroying the SharedImage or writing new content to it before using it.

histogram.name: GPU.SoftwareRendering
histogram.summary: Collects whether Chrome uses software renderer or hardware GPU 20 seconds after Chrome starts, and records this value once per UMA ping. This value is not re-collected at each recording time because GPU process could crash for various reasons and fall back to software rendering. This value is intended to reflect device capabilities rather than the current state.

histogram.name: GPU.Stage3DFieldTrial
histogram.summary: Records whether a client was selected for the Stage3D on XP field trial or not.

histogram.name: GPU.SupportsDisableMsaa
histogram.summary: This metric records if we had support for non-aa draws with hardware MSAA via GL_EXT_multisample_compatibility. Recorded once for each raster task that had non-aa draw.

histogram.name: GPU.SupportsDX12
histogram.summary: This metric shows whether the GPU supports D3D12. It is recorded in the browser process 120 seconds after the browser launch.

histogram.name: GPU.SurfaceOwner.AImageReader.AcquireImageResult
histogram.summary: Counts the error code which is returned when AImageReader api call acquireLatestImageAsync fails.

histogram.name: GPU.SwapTimeUs
histogram.summary: This is logged once per frame if the output surface provides timing information. It measures the time of SwapBuffers call. Only reported when there is single surface swap in the same vsync interval. Only reported for platforms supporting high resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.TextureRG
histogram.summary: Whether RG texture support is available. Recorded each time a new context group is initialized and extensions are detected.

histogram.name: GPU.Vulkan.PipelineCache.LoadCacheHit
histogram.summary: Shows if we had a vkPipelineCache entry in cache when skia requested it. Recorded each time skia loads vkPipelineCache entry from the GrShaderCache.

histogram.name: GPU.Vulkan.PipelineCache.PopulatedCacheUsage
histogram.summary: Shows if the populated from disk cache entry was used by skia or discarded and why. Recorded when cache entry that was read from disk is either loaded by skia, overwriten by skia or discarded by GrShaderCache.

histogram.name: GPU.Vulkan.PipelineCache.Size
histogram.summary: Size of stored VkPipelineCache in kb. Recorded every time we store a pipeline cache item. Currently happens when gpu goes idle after we stored or loaded new shader.

histogram.name: GPU.Vulkan.PipelineCache.StoreDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of storeVkPipelineCacheData in Skia, this includes chromium side GrShaderCache::store. Recorded even if data didn't fit into the cache. Only reported for platforms supporting high resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.Vulkan.PipelineCache.vkCreateGraphicsPipelines
histogram.summary: Duration of vkCreateGraphicsPipelines call. Recorded every time Skia creates graphics pipeline. Only reported for platforms supporting high resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.WaitForVBlankErrorCode
histogram.summary: Whether WaitForVBlank operation has been successful or failed with one of the errors prompting a backup delay based v-sync mechanism. Recorded each time a new GPU v-sync signal is generated.

histogram.name: GPU.WatchdogThread.Event{ThreadType}
histogram.summary: Recorded for each time the GPU watchdog thread starts, crashes and ends.

histogram.name: GPU.WatchdogThread.Timeout{WatchdogStage}{ThreadType}
histogram.summary: Recorded timeout events when the GPU watchdog enters OnWatchdogTimeout.

histogram.name: GPU.WebGraphicsContext3D_Init_CanLoseContext
histogram.summary: Counts of context initialization that succeed or fail based on combinations of attributes requiring canRecoverFromContextLoss and devices that report can_lose_context. Failing Init is desired when a device can not guarantee it won't fail for a user that can not handle failures, e.g. DX9 on WinXP used by Canvas2D'

histogram.name: GPU.WinSAT.GamingScore
histogram.summary: The WinSAT (Windows System Assessment Tool) gaming graphics score. It is in the range 1.0-5.9 on Vista, 1.0-7.9 on Win7 and 1.0-9.9 on Win8. 0 represents a failure to get the score. This is collected each time Chrome is launched.

histogram.name: GPU.WinSAT.GamingScore2
histogram.summary: The WinSAT (Windows System Assessment Tool) gaming graphics score, scaled by 10x. It is in the range 10-59 on Vista, 10-79 on Win7 and 10-99 on Win8. 0 represents a failure to get the score. This is collected each time Chrome is launched.

histogram.name: GPU.WinSAT.GraphicsScore
histogram.summary: The WinSAT (Windows System Assessment Tool) graphics score. It is in the range 1.0-5.9 on Vista, 1.0-7.9 on Win7 and 1.0-9.9 on Win8. 0 represents a failure to get the score. This is collected each time Chrome is launched.

histogram.name: GPU.WinSAT.GraphicsScore2
histogram.summary: The WinSAT (Windows System Assessment Tool) graphics score, scaled by 10x. It is in the range 10-59 on Vista, 10-79 on Win7 and 10-99 on Win8. 0 represents a failure to get the score. This is collected each time Chrome is launched.

histogram.name: GPU.WinSAT.HasResults
histogram.summary: A boolean representing whether or not we succeeded in getting the system's WinSAT scores. This is collected each time Chrome is launched.

histogram.name: GPU.WinSAT.OverallScore
histogram.summary: The WinSAT (Windows System Assessment Tool) overall system score. This is the minimum of all the individual subscores. It is in the range 1.0-5.9 on Vista, 1.0-7.9 on Win7 and 1.0-9.9 on Win8. 0 represents a failure to get the score. This is collected each time Chrome is launched.

histogram.name: GPU.WinSAT.OverallScore2
histogram.summary: The WinSAT (Windows System Assessment Tool) overall system score, scaled by 10x. This is the minimum of all the individual subscores. It is in the range 10-59 on Vista, 10-79 on Win7 and 10-99 on Win8. 0 represents a failure to get the score. This is collected each time Chrome is launched.

histogram.name: GPU.WinSAT.ReadResultsFileTime
histogram.summary:
The amount of time it takes to read the WinSAT results. This is collected each time Chrome is launched.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Viz.DelegatedCompositing.Status
histogram.summary: An enum status result for attempted delegated compositing (success or failure reason) recorded every drawn frame. Currently only recorded for LaCros delegated compositing.

histogram.name: Viz.DisplayCompositor.OverlayNumProposedCandidates
histogram.summary: A count of the number of proposed overlay candidates available for overlay selection. Recorded every time a frame is rendered by the display compositor.

histogram.name: Viz.DisplayCompositor.OverlayQuadMaterial
histogram.summary: Quad material for current promoted overlay, per frame. Recorded every time a frame is rendered by the display compositor.

histogram.name: Viz.DisplayCompositor.OverlayStrategy
histogram.summary: Overlay strategies used to promote Hardware Overlays, once or more per frame. Recorded every time a frame is rendered by the display compositor, or once per overlay promoted if multiple were promoted.

histogram.name: Viz.DisplayCompositor.OverlaySwitchInterval
histogram.summary: The time, in milliseconds, since the change in overlay selection. Recorded every time a frame is rendered by the display compositor.

histogram.name: Viz.DisplayCompositor.RootDamageRect.Overlay
histogram.summary: Any root damage excluding overlay damage in the current frame?

histogram.name: Viz.DisplayCompositor.RootDamageRect.Underlay
histogram.summary: The root damage type excluding underlay damage in the current frame.

histogram.name: Viz.FileDescriptorTracking.TimeToCompute
histogram.summary:
Time spent computing the number of active File Descriptors. This is logged once every 5 minutes as the cost of this computation is estimated to be at least 1ms. Currently only recorded for LaCros delegated compositing.
Warning: This metric does not include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Viz.FileDescriptorTracking.{FdStat}
histogram.summary: {FdStat} File Descriptors for the GPU process. This is logged once every 5 minutes as the cost of this computation is estimated to be at least 1ms. Currently only recorded for LaCros delegated compositing.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.CaptureDuration
histogram.summary:
The time it took from when FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl sent a request for frame capture until the result becomes available to the capturer.
Format-agnostic version of `Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.[NV12/I420].CaptureDuration` histograms.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.CaptureSucceeded
histogram.summary:
Whether a capture initiated by FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl succeeded.
Format-agnostic version of `Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.[NV12/I420].CaptureSucceeded` histograms.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.FrameResurrected
histogram.summary: True if the capturer has used a resurrected video frame, thus avoiding having to reserve it from a frame pool, false otherwise.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.I420.CaptureDuration
histogram.summary:
The time it took from when FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl sent a request for an I420 readback until the result comes back and ReadI420Planes successfully finishes.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-03-07 to 2022-03-10; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.I420.CaptureSucceeded
histogram.summary:
Whether an I420 readback initiated by FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl succeeded.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2020-12-31 to 2022-03-10; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.I420.TotalDuration
histogram.summary: The time it took from when FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl decided that a new I420 frame needs to be produced to the moment when it was ready to deliver it. This encompasses the `Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.I420.CaptureDuration` time, but also includes time taken to render video capture overlays.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.NV12.CaptureDuration
histogram.summary:
The time it took from when FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl sent a request for an NV12 copy until the result comes back.
Note: The histogram logging was adjusted in M102 to align with how `Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.[RGBA/I420].CaptureDuration` histograms behave. After the change, this histogram also started including the time taken to set the color space on a video frame.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.NV12.CaptureSucceeded
histogram.summary: Whether an NV12 capture initiated by FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl succeeded.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.NV12.TotalDuration
histogram.summary: The time it took from when FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl decided that a new NV12 frame needs to be produced to the moment when it was ready to deliver it. This encompasses the `Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.NV12.CaptureDuration` time.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.ReserveFrameDuration
histogram.summary: The time it took for a frame pool to reserve a video frame that would then have its contents populated by the capturer. Will be logged only when `Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.FrameResurrected` is false.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.RGBA.CaptureDuration
histogram.summary: The time it took from when FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl sent a request for an RGBA readback until the result comes back and ReadRGBAPlane successfully finishes.

histogram.name: Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.TotalDuration
histogram.summary:
The time it took from when FrameSinkVideoCapturerImpl decided that a new frame needs to be produced to the moment when it was ready to deliver it. This encompasses the `Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.CaptureDuration` time, but also includes time taken to render video capture overlays.
Format-agnostic version of `Viz.FrameSinkVideoCapturer.[NV12/I420].TotalDuration` histograms.
